DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to investigate the impact of serum progesterone concentrations on the day of embryo transfer in egg donation cycles under hormonal replacement therapy. As secondary outcomes, the investigators will investigate if endometrial volume measured by three-dimensional (3D) ultrasound on the day of embryo transfer is related with progesterone levels and with chances of pregnancy.
DOC.brief_title: Predictive Value of Mid-luteal Serum Progesterone Levels in Egg Donation Cycles
DOC.criteria: Age<50 yo BMI < 30Kg/m2 Hormonal replacement cycle Endometrial thickness >6.5 mm during proliferative phase Transfer of one or two blastocyst grade AB according to ASEBIR Uterine pathology Cryptozoospermia Severe implantation failure (>6 GQ embryos transferred without success)
